definition: to refuse to admit (what one has done)/to disavow/to renege
to press against/to support/to prop up/to resist/to equal/to balance/to make up for/to mortgage/to arrive at/to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)
surname Lai
to depend on/to hang on in a place/bad/to renege (on promise)/to disclaim/to rat (on debts)/rascally/to blame/to put the blame on

sentences.english: Her husband disavowed her after 15 years of marriage and six children.
sentences.chinese: 她的丈夫在和她結婚15年有6個孩子後抵賴不認她。

sentences.english: These terms are clearly written in black and white. You can never deny them.
sentences.chinese: 這些條件白紙黑字，一清二楚，想抵賴是抵賴不掉的。

sentences.english: These terms are clearly written in black and white. You can never deny them.
sentences.chinese: 這些條件白紙黑字，一清二楚，想抵賴是抵賴不掉的。

sentences.english: The facts are clear and brook no denial.
sentences.chinese: 事實清清楚楚，不容抵賴。

sentences.english: This concept is known as non-repudiation.
sentences.chinese: 這一概念稱作不可抵賴性。

sentences.english: Before we cover that, let's talk about nonrepudiation.
sentences.chinese: 在討論這個問題之前，我們先說一說抗抵賴。
通過認證和審覈，不可抵賴。

sentences.english: The crimes committed by the Dalai Clique are irrefutable and pinned down by ironclad evidence.
sentences.chinese: 達賴集團的犯罪事實鐵證如山，是抵賴不掉的。

sentences.english: She brazened through the accusation from the witness stand.
sentences.chinese: 她厚顏無恥地抵賴證人對她的指控。

sentences.english: The more GDI denies, the guiltier they look.
sentences.chinese: GDI越是抵賴，看起來就越有罪。

definition: to reason with sb/to lecture
obscene language
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
reasonable self-defense/legitimate defense
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
shield/(fig.) excuse
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to deal with (an offender)
to quibble
to evade responsibility/to shirk
written repentance
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
